author: Staff Reporter
text:
The damaged car on the Udhagamandalam - Gudalur NH near the Old SP Office Junction on Saturday.—Photo: M. Sathyamoorthy

A 34-year-old woman was killed while three others were injured when a branch of a Silver Oak tree near the Old SP Office Junction on Ooty-Gudalur national highway fell on the car in which she was travelling on Saturday.

The police identified the deceased as R. Ilakiya of Mettur in Salem district. Police said that heavy winds led to the falling of the branch.

A case was registered under 174 (unnatural death) of the Code of Criminal Procedures.

According to police, the woman was on her way to visit her friend Bharathi who was admitted in a hospital in Udhagamandalam.

Her husband Sathyaseelan, a constable, was driving the car along with his mother Dhanalakshmi and son Vishal (10).

Ilakiya was declared as brought dead in Udhagamandalam Government Hospital, while Sathyaseelan was referred to a hospital in Coimbatore.

Vishal and Dhanalakshmi escaped with minor injuries, sources said.
title: Woman killed as branch of tree falls on car
